results.title: Communication and motivation: dealing successfully with today's students
results.brief_description: One of a series in which Dr William Glasser presents a problem solving approach for individuals in therapeutic situations and which can be applied to discipline in schools. Glasser combines his discussion of the Schools Without Failure concepts, and examines the ways in which motivation can be encouraged - laughter and fun, and the importance of self expression give a child recognition that will motivate him to work. Suitable for tertiary level and teachers.

results.title: Communicating effectively
results.creator_credit: Caryl Wickman, Nancy Evelyn and Sandler Institutional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “An Essential Skill for Job Success”.
Explores communications techniques, including both verbal and nonverbal skills, and stresses the importance of effective communication.

results.title: Come into my parlour, said the spider to the fly
results.creator_credit: Densey Clyne, Jim Frazier and Mantis Wildlife Films
results.brief_description: Deals with the predatory techniques of the Australian spiders that feed on insects. Includes spiders that build lidded burrows, spin webs, stack their prey, cast nets, or lure moths into a whirling line.

results.title: Colonial Williamsburg
results.brief_description: Williamsburg - for 80 years the capital of England’s Virginia colony - has been restored to its former appearance and today is the only city in America that actually portrays it colonial heritage in its proper setting. Visitors may see how is actually was in the 17th century.
results.description: Williamsburg - for 80 years the capital of England’s Virginia colony - has been restored to its former appearance and today is the only city in America that actually portrays it colonial heritage in its proper setting. Visitors may see how is actually was in the 17th century.

results.title: Elizabeth Riddell
results.creator_credit: John Erichsen, Australia Council and Royce Smeal Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Videos on Australian Writers: archival writers series II”.
Elizabeth Riddell came to Australia from New Zealand when she was eighteen. She recalls the community of artists and writers in Sydney in the 1930’s and her early experiences as a journalist. During the Second World War Riddell reported from North America and travelled through Europe. On her return to Australia, her long autobiographical poem was published. Riddell discusses the conflict between the demands of her career and her desire to write poetry. She speaks about the discipline of writing and the state of contemporary Australian literature.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Erichsen, Australia Council and Royce Smeal Film Productions
